presentation_title: Software Engineering Job Market 2025: Trends & Opportunities

slides.title: Software Engineering Job Market 2025
slides.subtitle: Trends, Salaries & Career Opportunities
key_points: Comprehensive analysis of current market conditions
Based on 2024-2025 employment data
Strategic insights for career planning
slides.visual_style: Professional tech presentation with data visualization elements, clean modern design, blue and green color scheme

slides.title: Market Overview: Steady Growth Recovery
key_points: 17% projected job growth through 2033 (327,000 new roles)
~140,000 annual openings including turnover
Tech unemployment at 2% (tight labor market)
Big Tech headcount recovery: Meta +19%, Google +16%, Apple +13%
slides.visual_style: Growth chart visualization, upward trending graphs, corporate logos of major tech companies

slides.title: Salary Trends: Strong Compensation Growth
key_points: Median salary: $133,080 (24% growth since 2018)
Top 10% exceed $200K annually
Middle 50% range: $101K - $167K
66% of managers increasing starting salaries for key roles
slides.visual_style: Salary bar charts, currency symbols, upward trend indicators, clean financial data visualization

slides.title: AI Engineering: The Explosive Growth Sector
key_points: Dramatic surge in AI engineering listings since mid-2023
32% of AI jobs concentrated in San Francisco Bay Area
Top employers: OpenAI, Anthropic, Meta, Google, Amazon
Remote work INCREASING for AI roles (unlike overall market)
slides.visual_style: AI/tech visualization, neural network graphics, concentration map showing Bay Area dominance

slides.title: Skills in High Demand: 2025 Requirements
key_points: Core languages: Python, Java, C++, JavaScript/TypeScript, C#
Cloud platforms: AWS, Azure, GCP expertise
DevOps tools: Docker, Kubernetes essential
54% of hiring managers report AI reshaping skill requirements
slides.visual_style: Technology stack icons, skill bar charts, programming language logos arranged by demand

slides.title: Remote Work: The New Normal
key_points: 27% of software jobs advertised as remote
80% of engineers expected remote work by end 2025
50% hybrid model emerging as standard
Non-tech sectors aggressively hiring remote engineers (91% growth)
slides.visual_style: Home office setup imagery, remote collaboration icons, work-life balance illustrations

slides.title: Career Opportunities & Market Shifts
key_points: 50%+ of open roles are senior-level or higher
86% of high-paying positions at publicly traded companies
Platform vs Product AI engineering specialization paths
Non-tech sectors: Finance (+91%), Industrial Automation (+73%)
slides.visual_style: Career path flowchart, company growth indicators, industry sector comparison charts

slides.title: Strategic Takeaways for 2025
key_points: Market stabilizing with strong growth trajectory
AI integration skills becoming essential baseline
Remote work flexibility remains competitive advantage
Continuous learning critical for career advancement
slides.visual_style: Forward-looking graphics, success imagery, clean conclusion layout with key action items
